Let's go!
Prologue|Frost
The innkeeper crawls across the floor behind the bar as slowly as he can, terrified of making a sound
Alerting them...her...of his presence would surely mean death
Her nearby voice, smooth but with a tone as hard and cold as ice, reminds the innkeeper of how close she is
Round up as many bodies as you can, prioritise the ones that succumbed to the frost, but any will do
Scurrying footsteps reveal more in the room, followed by a guttural, barely human sounding response
Yes, queen. But if I may...we are hungry-
Control yourself, Gethys, we have work to do. Be assured you will be first to know if there are spares
She barks back, not waiting for the creature to finish. The scuffling sounds of movement confirm that her orders are being followed
Panic surges through the innkeeper; it's only a matter of time before they come across him, and escaping unnoticed would not be easy
The windows had all been boarded up in an effort to better defend the remaining locals from the frost
Not that it had helped at all in the end, the witch had come straight through the front door with her creatures and overwhelmed them
Escaping via the front door, however, was out of the question with the room full of those things
The sliver of light creeping in under the back door catches his eye from down the corridor
It had been barricaded like everything else, but throwing his weight into it would probably do the trick
Listening for a moment, the innkeeper attempts to judge whether there is a good time to make his move
Just go you old fool!
And with that bit of self-motivation, the man makes his way to the door. Crouching at first, he soon breaks into a full run and braces for impact
Luckily, the old wooden door splinters easily, though with a loud crash as he tumbles through onto the frosted stone streets
His shoulder throbs with pain from the landing, but he picks himself up quickly
It takes a moment to adjust to the light, made more difficult by the thick mist and icy cold wind causing frost to form on his large beard
Just...keep...moving
Ducking into a small, dark alley beside the inn, he moves as quickly as possible, though the intense cold makes it difficult
Upon reaching the end of the alley joining the main street, he pauses to carefully peek out
Even after everything, the sight on the main street shakes the innkeeper to his core
Hundreds of the hideous ghouls, all dragging dead villagers up the street towards the north
The worst part is the recognition of most of the bodies
Old Craig, the slightly tedious but well-loved local storyteller
Tilly, the sweet young daughter of the herbalists that lived next door to the inn...
So many lifeless faces of those he had come to love
The innkeeper can't help but feel personally responsible. He had assured the townsfolk he could keep them safe
I'm sorry, I've failed you all
Caught in a daze, the movement from behind goes unnoticed, and suddenly something strong yanks him hard to the ground
Sharp pain courses across his back, the claws of a ghoul no doubt
Moments later the paralysis begins to set in, the innkeeper totally unable to move
His vision begins to fade, and while being dragged across the cobbles, he can just about make out the voice of the witch
An interesting one, he might be more useful to harvest alive
You feel the dream begin to slip away, do you want to extend it (check the Tonic screen)?#FIRST_DREAM_RELEASE=Let the dream fade|TONIC_FIRST_DREAM_EXTEND=Consume tonic to extend it
The dream slips away...
You draw on the tonic you drank earlier to extend the dream
An extra few seconds reveals the destination of the creatures and their bounty; a large manor house on the hill at the north end of town
The voice of the one the innkeeper had thought of as 'the witch' interrupts your thoughts
I can feel you watching child, I think that's enough for now
A sharp pain courses through your mind and the dream ends
Chapter 1|Campfire
You awake covered in sweat, your throat dry and sore
The dream still lingers in your mind. It had felt so real, and you shiver at the memory of the frost, despite the warm summer morning
You'd always had odd dreams but had only learned recently that you qualified as a Dreamer, gifted with the ability to witness events in both the past and future
But this dream felt different, unrelated to your current mission and the people involved seemed alien
Argus, the stout and always jovial dwarf notices your distress
Morning, $name! Anything we should be concerned about?
How do you respond to Argus?#FIRST_DREAM_OPEN=Tell him about the dream|FIRST_DREAM_CLOSED=Make an excuse
It was intense but short. I saw a town, there is...or was...an evil there. Creatures rounding up bodies of the townsfolk
I didn't see anyone that matches our target though, so I can't be sure it's even the right location
The memory of the dream is already hazy; you haven't been doing this long after all
Argus looks at you for a moment, concerned, then shrugs and rubs the skin around his eyepatch
Don't give too much stock to it young one, I'm sure they don't all come true
He pats you reassuringly on the shoulder, his jovial tone comforting you
However, he falls silent for a moment and you can't help but sense some uncertainty in him
It seemed better to keep this dream to yourself for now, it felt different from your usual dreams which revealed recent events from the past or near-future
Nothing, just a headache
Argus frowns, then nods and rubs the skin around his eye patch
Same. A few too many wines round the campfire last night eh? Don't worry, Vara will look after us!
Despite his understanding tone, his eyes linger on you for a moment longer, probing for something more
Vara, the tall, stern elf with mousy-brown hair and a large scar across her neck, breaks the awkward silence
She tosses a full water skin into your lap
Here, drink this. We need to move on
Argus rolls his eyes then chuckles
Come now Vara, let the kid wake up!
At first, Vara seems to be ignoring him, then her usual half-smile breaks across her face
At least he got some sleep, you oaf! Your snoring kept me up all night; it's a wonder you didn't alert any bandits to our presence
Argus begins laughing uncontrollably for a moment, then managers to recover himself somewhat
Lies, I didn't hear myself snoring at all!
He winks at you as he says this, clearly just trying to provoke Vara
She seems not to take the bait however, shaking her head dismissively, and begins packing up her things
Looking over, you see the twins, Jimmy and Tasha, also packing up. They both give you a reassuring smile and motion for you to hurry up
Not that you have much to pack up...
What is your weapon of choice?#WEAPON_SWORD=A trusty short sword|WEAPON_BOW=A hunting bow|WEAPON_STAFF=A versatile staff
You attach your sword belt and sheath to your waist; you barely know how to use it, but it still makes you feel slightly safer
You sling the bow and quiver onto your pack; you barely know how to use it, but it still makes you feel slightly safer
You pick up the smooth wooden bo staff; you barely know how to use it, but it still makes you feel slightly safer
Tossing your bedding into you pack hastily, you make sure your most important belonging, the Dreamer's Tonic, is secure
The tonic not only helps you feel rested after sleep, it intensifies and clarifies the dreams. The bright, cobalt-speckled liquid is also somewhat mesmerising to watch
Snapping out of your daze, you hear Argus' impatient tone from a small distance away
Come on $name! Like Vara says, "we need to move on"
You chuckle quietly at his exaggerated attempt to impersonate Vara, and hurry to catch up
Chapter 2|The Road
Argus and Vara, the Protectors, made a great pair; at face value they were polar opposites, but they got along far better than theyâ€™d ever care to admit
The twins Jimmy and Tasha on the other hand often seemed like the same person; finishing each-others thoughts in an eccentric manner. They were Shifters, who always tended to be an odd lot
Protectors were those Attuned with short-term foresight, which gave them the ability to predict another persons immediate intentions; a noticeable advantage in a fight
Shifters on the other hand were able to alter the intentions of others through suggestion; this tended to be more useful in cases were diplomacy was required
I'm not usually one to brag about this, but I was quite the hearthrob in my younger days
One summer I got the attention of the crown princess Ivenha herself! Approached me at a party she did
Of course, it would had been mighty rude of me to turn her away, so we talked, and drank - oh she could drink!
Argus pauses for a moment and seems lost in the memory, before catching himself
But! The king, well, he didn't like his daughter mingling with a commoner like me...
You notice a glimmer of moisture in the boisterous dwarf's eyes, and sense something more to this story
When I refused to stop seeing her, the bastard had me arrested took my eye as punishment!
Argus barks a laugh as he proclaims this, while Jimmy and Tasha seem totally captivated
You suddenly notice a plume of smoke rising in the direction of your destination
Vara also seems to have noticed, and instinctively places her hands on her sheathed knives
We're almost there, but it looks like we're heading into trouble
Tasha sighs heavily and a deep frown appears on her usually happy face
I was really hoping for a peaceful one this time round
Argus pats her on the back a little too forcefully
I wasn't!
And with almost a gleeful expression, he charges off ahead
Chapter 3|The Town
By the time you arrive, the flames are dancing across the town of Wellspring uncontrollably
Argus turns as he notices the rest of you approach
Seems we might be a wee bit late...
Vara nods, then begins scanning the buildings to assess the situation
We must hurry, if we can't find the priest we won't be getting paid for this one
She looks over the group, her eyes resting on you
Dreamer, I know you're new, but can you give us any information?
You'd only recently learned it was possible to use your gifts to read situations; a way to shift your consciousness and see glimpses of the past
I can try
You shut your eyes and attempt to focus on something
What do you focus on?#READ_WELLSPRING_PRIEST=The priest|READ_WELLSPRING_FIRE=The fire
You try to relax your mind, allowing your consciousness to slip away
The sound of the fire and pressure of everyone watching makes it difficult, so you attempt to push that out of your mind
Focusing on the priest, as he had been described to you, you picture an old man with short white hair in the white and blue robes of Marr
You feel a strong gust of wind hit you and suddenly you are watching this old man, he is arguing with another
The other man is tall and stocky, has a full dark brown beard and wears a somewhat dirty apron
Their voices are muffled and impossible to make out through sound of rushing wind, but it is clear they disagree
The priest points down the street to other end of town where a large, lone house sits on a hill
The other man hesitates for a moment, contemplating something and looks back towards another building, a tavern
Looking back at the priest the man shakes his head and enters the tavern
The priest looks furious at first, then just disappointed, before turning and walking in the direction he previously pointed
Focusing on the fire, you try to picture the flames and understand what caused it
